guideline.name: Annotation of DPWG Guideline for omeprazole and CYP2C19

relatedGenes.name: cytochrome P450 family 2 subfamily C member 19

recommendations.name: Recommendation PA166299194

text.html: NO action is required for this gene-drug interaction.

implications: The higher plasma concentration of omeprazole results in an increase in the therapeutic effectiveness, without an increase in the side effects.

recommendations.name: Recommendation PA166299193

text.html: NO action is required for this gene-drug interaction.

implications: The higher plasma concentration of omeprazole results in an increase in the therapeutic effectiveness, without an increase in the side effects.

recommendations.name: Recommendation PA166299196

text.html: The guideline does not provide a recommendation for omeprazole in normal metabolizers.

implications: The guideline does not provide a description of the impact of a normal metabolizer phenotype on omeprazole.

recommendations.name: Recommendation PA166299195

text.html: For Helicobacter pylori ERADICATION THERAPY: 1. Use a 3-fold higher dose. 2. Advise the patient to contact their doctor if symptoms of dyspepsia persist. OTHER INDICATIONS: 1. Be alert to reduced effectiveness. 2. If necessary, use a 3-fold higher dose. 3. Advise the patient to report persisting symptoms of dyspepsia.

implications: The genetic variation may lead to a reduced omeprazole plasma concentration and therefore reduced effectiveness.

citations.title: Pharmacogenetics: from bench to byte--an update of guidelines.
authors: Rongen G A P J M
